newsitem.title: MALTA: Malta to double hospital size in $250 mln project.
newsitem.headline: Malta to double hospital size in $250 mln project.

text.p: Malta is to double the size of a hospital now being built, to provide 800 beds in a project expected to cost over $250 million over four years, Prime Minister Alfred Sant said on Tuesday.
Sant told a news conference that funding the hospital was a challenge for his cash-strapped government which would be seeking international help.
The project, started by the former Nationalist government, was originally intended to complement an existing general hospital.

The Labour government, elected last October, says two general hospitals would cost too much in cash and staffing. Services from the existing, 60-year-old St Luke's Hospital will therefore be absorbed by the new project.
It had not been decided yet whether Swedish construction group Skanska, awarded the contract to build the hospital as originally designed, would now be responsible for all of the enlarged project.
